definitions.definition: give (someone) money that is due for work done, goods received, or a debt incurred.
examples: he paid the locals to pick his coffee beans
synonyms: remunerate More"I want to pay him for his work"fund
treat someone to; informalfoot the bill for
pony up for "I'll pay for dinner"

definitions.definition: give (a sum of money) in exchange for goods or work done or in discharge of a debt.
examples: he paid $1,000 to have it built in 1977
synonyms: pony up "Tom must pay a few more dollars"

definitions.definition: hand over or transfer the amount due of (a debt, wages, etc.) to someone.
examples: bonuses were paid to savers whose policies completed their full term

definitions.definition: (of work, an investment, etc.) yield or provide someone with (a specified sum of money).
examples: jobs that pay $5 or $6 an hour

definitions.definition: (of a business or undertaking, or an attitude) be profitable or advantageous to someone.
synonyms: produce More"hard work will pay dividends"be profitable
make a profit "he made the buses pay"be advantageous
benefit "it doesn't pay to get involved"

definitions.definition: suffer a loss or other misfortune as a consequence of an action.
examples: the destroyer responsible for these atrocities would have to pay with his life
synonyms: pay the penalty/price "he will pay for his mistakes"

definitions.definition: give what is due or deserved to (someone); reward or punish.
give or bestow (attention, respect, or a compliment) on (someone).
examples: no one paid them any attention

definitions.definition: make (a visit or a call) to (someone).
examples: she has been prevailed upon to pay us a visit

definitions.definition: seal (the deck or hull seams of a wooden ship) with pitch or tar to prevent leakage.
